author: @Theevil6ify
text:
This case helps illustrate the clear use of social "oppression" and victimhood as a form of currency, something that more than a few lefties I've talked to have pretended to not understand or just outright denied its existence. 
"Why would a victim of assault lie about being assaulted?" 
"Why would an lgbt person lie about being discriminated against?" 
As if this is something a CHILD doesn't understand. You garner sympathy, you get to craft an image of strength and endurance around you for being a "survivor", and in some cases you can get a LOT of money in lawsuits against the accused parties. Unfortunately for Smollet he forgot that real life doesn't function like the fictional and dramatic scripts he's used to memorizing.

replies.author: @FablesTold
replies.text:
Everytime a liberal I know does this, I like to counter by agreeing that all victims should be believed, and that those damn witches abusing those poor little girls down in Salem got off easy, we should've killed them all more slowly.  Or I ask them what the fuss was about with lynchings because *clearly* there was no reason for those women to ever lie about being assaulted by those black men, they had nothing to gain from it.

Usually keeps them from talking to me more than the bare minimum for at least a week.
